website_summaries.verdict: This overhead, space-saving jar opener opens lids of all types for elderly customers, amputees, and individuals with joint problems.
pros: Grabs hold of any lid – factory sealed, child proof, tamper proof or sticky
Easy to install with peel-and-stick adhesive and screws
Ideal for children the elderly, those with joint problems, amputees, and kitchen workers
Takes off lids up to 6 inches
cons: Leaves some rough spots around the edge of metal items

customer_reviews.title: Works well, but here is a better way to install it.
customer_reviews.text: Works well if installed properly. The picture above is backwards. It should be installed with the bottom of the "V" pointing toward the person holding the jar, not the opposite. That way a person can place both hands on the jar to get better twisting action, helps to keep the jar lid flat against the top of the opener, which makes the opener work better, pull the jar toward you and twist, helps to keep balance when the lid starts to open. Install at the front edge of the cabinet, not toward the wall. Woody S, Virginia Beach
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: My best gadget ever!
customer_reviews.text: I have tried a million different tools and gadgets for help in opening jars of all sizes, and each one had its own issues! Finally, someone has invented the perfect jar opener that is simple and requires no space in your kitchen drawers or counters. There was one person who suggested placing the opener with the sharp end of the "V" closest to you and with it placed in the front, right corner under your cabinet. I followed those directions and it works perfectly and easily. I have already placed an order for another one for a gift or my sister.
customer_reviews.author: moorecats

customer_reviews.title: Works well but.......
customer_reviews.text: It requires 3 screws to install properly. The ones that came with it are way too short as they only protrude approximately 1/8 of an inch beyond the depth of the opener so it isn't going to hold at all. The least they could do is include proper length screws. Once installed with appropriate screws it is rock solid and works like a charm - my wife loves it!
customer_reviews.author: alfisch

customer_reviews.title: Caved in the lid but works great give it an A+
customer_reviews.text: Ok got it today.I put it up with the V toward me so I pull not push as someone said to do. I agree I think it is easier to pull a log chain than push it. I have only used it twice on the same jar. I have had this jar of pickled asparagus for 3 years & no one could open it. In fact that jar is why I got the EZ off. Yes I did have to use a little muscle on it but think my 12 year old granddaughter could have opened the jar with it. I caved in the lid but i give it an A+
customer_reviews.author: Jon

customer_reviews.title: Deserves high ratings!
customer_reviews.text: This was so easy to install with the sticky back to position and hold it up! Took less than 3 minutes, and no drill needed for our cabinets. The drop on the front cabinet is 1 3/4"; at eye level (photo on left) you cannot see the opener at all, plus it fits between my undercounter lights (right). Very pleased as it is much easier & faster to use than finding a rubber gripper buried in the drawer.
customer_reviews.author: Mumsers

customer_reviews.title: Don't Waste Your Money!
customer_reviews.text: This is garbage. I can't even return it and get a refund because I can't get it off from under my cabinet! I tried several jars. It didn't open any of them. No matter how hard I tried, this useless thing did nothing. I had to use the pointy end of a cheap can/bottle opener and pry under the lid to open the jars. What good is a guarantee if you can't use it since this product can't be pried off the bottom of the cabinet? $16 down the drain. I'd give it a "0" rating if I could!
customer_reviews.author: Alice PA

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste money like I did
customer_reviews.text: Total waste of money. Glue is weak, screws are short. Can't install under cabinet with either a stubby or a ratchet screwdriver.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: No stars. Overpriced and difficult to install. Not recommend
customer_reviews.text: The screws aren’t the correct size. The adhesive didn’t hold long enough to try and use the screws. As correct installation is critical to the product’s function and the product cannot be installed with equipment and instructions provided. To my mind I paid full price for a half a product. And instead of an easy installation I got a project. I wouldn’t recommend this product nor would I buy it again
customer_reviews.author: JeanieQ

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: Once in a while you stumble on a product that is better than advertised. This is one of them. Having arthritis in my hands, I struggle to open some large jars. This works like a charm and makes it a one-handed operation. Following the advice of another reviewer, we mounted it ‘backwards’ so the point of the V is towards the front of the cupboard rather than the back. This allows us to pull the jar towards us, rather than pushing it away. It also means we can’t see the metal teeth from our sofa. Now I want to open every jar in the house :-)
customer_reviews.author: Eric K.

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy!
customer_reviews.text: I found it worthless! The lids just slide. They should have put teeth on both sides so is could grip the lid?
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Screws way to short
customer_reviews.text: This seems to be a good product except for the screws that were supplied with it. The teeth are very sharp. We will see how well it holds up under normal use.
customer_reviews.author: A. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: Mounted under cabinet with screws. Have opened many different sized jars with ease. I no longer have to rely on my husband to get a jar open.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A most excellent product for lid removal
customer_reviews.text: A simple but very useful product. We have purchased 6 of them for our own use plus to give as gifts. The bottom line is this product works, does what it claims it will do which is to remove jar lids. It is easy to mount underneath a cabinet, in the kitchen. So far my wife nor I have found a lid we can't remove using this device. With it permanently mounted it is always in the same place and not lost in some drawer. We have one in the kitchen of our house and our motorhome. It is well built and should last for many years. Everything needed to install is included.
customer_reviews.author: Joe B.

customer_reviews.title: The person using it said "it's one of the best mobility aids I've ever used"
customer_reviews.text: This was bought for a physically challenged person who can't open ANY jars on their own. I installed it backwards from the description - so the opening is facing away from you and you have to pull the jar TOWARDS yourself. There's way more leverage available that way to open things. The person using it said "it's one of the best mobility aids I've ever used". Unbelievable for just a jar opener but you can use it for pill bottles, milk lids, just anything with a twisting lid really.
customer_reviews.author: wetcoast79

customer_reviews.title: Work well, wrong screws
customer_reviews.text: I had read about the mounting screws being too short in these reviews, and I just couldn't believe it. Well it is true. I substituted 1 1/4 inch screws and they did the job without going completely through the cabinet bottom. Unit works well. They have mounted two sections of band saw blade to grip the jar lid. If you slipped somehow you could severely cut yourself. Please be careful.
customer_reviews.author: Merk

customer_reviews.title: Gone are the days when my weak hands are defeated ...
customer_reviews.text: Gone are the days when my weak hands are defeated by yet another jar that defies my power. No longer do I have to wait for my strapping husband to come home, handing him various jars to open so I can nourish him and my children who waited all day in hunger to be fed. Nay, a full 7 course meal awaits him each day, as he comes home in awe of my skill to finally be able to cook dinner by myself, with the EZ off jar opener performing the hard work of ten men in the delicate grip of one my small, feminine hands.
customer_reviews.author: SB

customer_reviews.title: All your friends will be impressed.
customer_reviews.text: They actually will be, its not a joke. When they ask you where you got it you can snoodly reply "Amazon idiot, where do you get ANYTHING anymore?" But seriously, this opens just about anything with a lid on it. Its super easy and makes up for our feeble little human hands that arnt made to crank things off. If we had octopus arms you wouldnt need one of these for anything. But we dont have octopus arms. Thats a silly notion it would be much easier to put a human head on an octopus body than it would be to put octopus arms on a human body.
customer_reviews.author: Maxter50

customer_reviews.title: Not New as Marked
customer_reviews.text: Product was not new. Was in a damaged box with red crayon. Jar opener not in plastic. Red crayon all over with the crayon in box No screws that were supposed to be included.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel McClelland

customer_reviews.title: Rusted in a week
customer_reviews.text: The edges rusted before I even installed it. I pulled it out of the box when I received it and set it in a drawer in the kitchen to install it later. When I pulled it out to set it up, the blades were rusted. Too bad I waited so long that I missed the return window. Pass on it, unless you like tetanus.
customer_reviews.author: Sly

customer_reviews.title: Works like magic, but needs longer screws
customer_reviews.text: I am 75 and have arthritis in my hands. I ordered 2 jar openers, a hand-held one and the EZ-Off. I couldn't budge a jar lid with the hand-held opener because of the grip required in both hands. I just installed the under-cabinet EZ-Off and it works so effortlessly that I can't believe how easy it is. It requires no strength or twisting of one's hands. The reviewer who complained that the provided screws are too short is right, though; I swapped them out for longer ones because I couldn't get the other ones to take hold in the wood. Best thing I ever bought online!
customer_reviews.author: JDC

customer_reviews.title: The saw-tooth finish mars the edge of the jar. ...
customer_reviews.text: The saw-tooth finish mars the edge of the jar. so, in a product you continue using after opening (rather than discarding the lid), the lid scratches or even cuts your fingers. I eat a lot of olives! If I use the opener, the lid is marred and I have to be very careful opening it.
customer_reviews.author: Bree A. Benson

customer_reviews.title: Lifesaver
customer_reviews.text: As I have gotten older, have trouble with my hands and have lost the strength to remove a lot of lids. This one is good for all sizes. I was amazed at how versatile it is and for a product that is inexpensive. Who knew?! Great invention. I was afraid my cabinet wasn't thick enough to support it but it holds fine and couldn't be more pleased with how it handles even the smallest bottles like water or soda bottles and larger sizes like mayo. My husband installed it easily and I use it practically everyday.
customer_reviews.author: Dee

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Product!
customer_reviews.text: This jar opener works so well. I love it! I have arthritis in one hand and opening jars, regardless of what I tried, was very difficult. Bought this because a physical therapist recommended it and I am so glad I did. It was very easy to install under my upper cabinets and is not visible. It came with instructions and proper screws. It also had a sticky pad with it to hold it in place while you screwed it in permanently. That was a big help! Overall, 5 stars for everything about this product.
customer_reviews.author: J. Terrell

customer_reviews.title: easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Really bought it for my 82 year old mom..she was always bring jars to me to open for her. I had Ulnar surgery awhile ago and have lost a lot of strength in my left hand...but with this , the lids come off with ease. My 82 year old mom has not asked me to open a lid since I installed it. I installed it under the cupboard so it would be out of sight and not clogging up counter space like the electric one she put in the garage because it took to much room lol
customer_reviews.author: Richard T. Gross

customer_reviews.title: It didn't help
customer_reviews.text: I really like the large jars of mango slices from Costco. I thought this would help, but it did not.
customer_reviews.author: Agatha Christie

customer_reviews.title: Great product. Better than I hoped for.
customer_reviews.text: I was very skeptical that this would work as advertised, but was swayed by all the positive reviews. I have great difficulty opening jars etc. because of a chronic condition. This works! So happy about it. I would most sincerely recommend it to anyone who has a problem with gripping and turning to open jars, etc. Try it! I believe you will be pleased. Also, listen to the reviews that say to install it with the point of the V facing you. It is easier that way.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy N.

customer_reviews.title: It actually works.
customer_reviews.text: I have tried several jar openers over the years and this one is without a doubt the BEST. I did have to use a screwdriver for three screws to mount it under my kitchen cupboard. I had no problem doing that and I am not necessarily good at using tools. They provide a double sided sticky tape to position it and hold it in position before you have to use a screwdriver. Just love it.!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Jablit

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for opening all types of cans.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this product for my mother who has arthritis and has trouble opening cans and jars. This thing is awesome and she loves it! Super easy to install, peel off the adhesive backing, stick it on, and screw in the two screws. You can't even see it under the cabinet. My mom loves it and says that she hasn't found a jar that it won't open and that it works better than the grip things that you manually use. Note: the blades are pretty sharp on this thing so you will want to make sure you are careful when using it and make sure it's out of reach for kids and pets.
customer_reviews.author: Jasmine Norris-Dixson

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product!!
customer_reviews.text: I am 74 yr old man with diminished wrist and hand strength. I live alone so no one to help opening jars. I won't bother to delineate the jar opening techniques I had to employ before I purchased this solution. Simple to use and install. One person took issue with screw length. There are many cabinet thickness, so it would not reasonable to expect every possible length of screw. I elected to use longer screws. Works perfectly!
customer_reviews.author: Joseph

customer_reviews.title: This jar opener is wonderful and works perfectly
customer_reviews.text: This jar opener is wonderful and works perfectly! Fits nicely (screws in) under a cabinet and does exactly what it claims to do! We love it and have had no problems with it! So far whatever jar we've had to open this opens very nicely and with little to no effort! There is one jar product in particular that we buy on a regular basis and the jar has always been pretty much impossible to open any other way, however with this gadget the jar opens so easily! We have been very impressed and would highly, highly recommend this to anyone who is looking to open jars more easily!
customer_reviews.author: KWB

customer_reviews.title: can’t open any jars
customer_reviews.text: Fails to open jars. Would have returned it, but it’s stuck on my cabinet.
customer_reviews.author: IBM

customer_reviews.title: the end-all jar/ bottle opener
customer_reviews.text: every other day I have to open a bottle of gator aid, and the plastic top is a problem, I was using a pair of vice grips from my tool box, but it had a size limitation on the jars and bottles it could handle, and the containers of frozen gelato were too big. we bought a pair of pliers from amazon, but to open the gelato the pliers would just barely reach around the cap, and at the full extension of the pliers, I could just barely get my hand on the pliers this easy jar is fabulous and I haven't yet found any thing it couldn't handle.
customer_reviews.author: KENNETH R. TREIBER

customer_reviews.title: Definitely effective!!
customer_reviews.text: .As an occupational therapist I am always looking for ways to decrease stress on our joints. This device makes opening jars a piece of cake. I agree with those people suggesting placing the opener with the sharp end of the "V" closest to you and with it placed in the front, right corner under your cabinet. We intend to get one for each of the kids for Christmas!
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Grace Walker Gray

customer_reviews.title: Annoyingly short screws
customer_reviews.text: This product could have been great, but who was the brainchild who thought a short screw with barely 3mm protruding would be enough to screw into a cabinet?! I had to buy alternate screws to install it, so 3 stars for making this a frustrating experience when 2 extra 10 cent screws would have made this non-issue.
customer_reviews.author: OfficeSpace

customer_reviews.title: You'll be glad you have one of these!
customer_reviews.text: As we age, it gets harder and harder to open jars, right? Well, this device works really well for me. Has never failed to open a tough jar, with a modicum of effort. One caution: be sure to install the opener where it is handy to use -- I installed the opener in a location in which I have to reach so far to get the jar in place that it's sometimes difficult, but that's my fault for selecting an inconvenient location! Put the opener where it's easy to reach and you'll love it!
customer_reviews.author: Blue Grass

customer_reviews.title: Works great!!! Easy to use!!!
customer_reviews.text: My mother has arthritis. She is unable to open any jar or water bottle. I installed this for her and she is able to open up her peanut butter jars and water bottles with ease. I absolutely love this product. It is a wonderful blessing. It’s easy to install and easy to use. I highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia Torres

customer_reviews.title: Hooray! I can open my jars now.
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing! But be aware, when you mount it, do not use the adhesive, use a couple of screws so that is mounted firmly and tightly. Once you do that, it is out of the way and unseen until you have to use it. It's really like having an extra set of hands to help you open a jar. Very highly recommended but remember, mounted with the screws not the double-sided tape!
customer_reviews.author: Christian in Florida

customer_reviews.title: Had to go to garage to get screws that were long enough to hold
customer_reviews.text: Had to go to garage to get screws that were long enough to hold.
customer_reviews.author: the sewist

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy this
customer_reviews.text: The screws are not longer enough to affix the device to the cabinetry. Don't waste your money!
customer_reviews.author: slavid

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: This little gadget is wonderful! I am an older woman with arthritis in my hands and many jars/bottles are nearly impossible for me to open. If my husband wasn't home, I just had to forget it until he could do it for me. I haven't found anything this little gem won't open (even nail polish). It takes a time or two to get used to exactly how to hold your bottle or jar, but after that, no problem! It will gouge a smooth plastic lid a bit, but I haven't found it to be a problem. I love it and have recommended it to friends.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great product.
customer_reviews.text: This is the best jar opener I have ever used. I did follow a previous reviewer's suggestion and installed it in the opposite direction from the way it is pictured. Instead of pushing the jar into the opener and twisting, I place the jar and pull it towards me, then twist to open. For me that is so much easier and I have much better control. Works really well, even with plastic jars/lids. We did use longer screws than were supplied per several recommendations.
customer_reviews.author: Avid Reader

customer_reviews.title: Great for arthritic hands
customer_reviews.text: Following advice from previous reviewers, installed this with the opening away from me (the point on the “V” towards me) and it has been easy for me to use. I have arthritis in both thumbs and less torque for opening jars because of this, so this opener has been very helpful. I’d buy it again and recommend it with confidence.
customer_reviews.author: Judy C.

customer_reviews.title: Injured
customer_reviews.text: We purchased two of these as we have arthritis. The product opens jars easily but makes nicks in the lid with jagged metal and it is Very Dangerous! Cannot use them.
customer_reviews.author: El-Nor

customer_reviews.title: Works very well but be careful
customer_reviews.text: The product works very well in opening lids of all sizes but you need to be careful. There are rather sharp, angled metal teeth that dig into the lid as you rotate the body of the container. if you push in too forcefully, the teeth dig in too much. If you're tentative about it, the teeth slip and scratch the lid until you apply more force. You should also be mindful of where you mount the device because the exposed sharp teeth of the unit could cut your fingers. All that being said, I'd buy it again, it's made my life easier.
customer_reviews.author: Gregory Lim

customer_reviews.title: Great product. Ingenious design
customer_reviews.text: Bought this cuz a lot of the reviews i read here were positive and boy, were they right. 5 minutes to install. The adhesive is very strong and the screws are tiny, so they're easily screwed in. The teeth on the opener grip every can and bottle i've tried so far and opened all with ease. I initially bought this cuz I had a jar of salsa that I just could not get open. i tried everything and was afraid to break the glass jar if i used pipe wrenches. This opener got it open with ease and I have a bad elbow that makes it hard for me to twist with force. Just an amazing product!!
customer_reviews.author: T. J.

customer_reviews.title: The Best Jar Opener I've Tried!
customer_reviews.text: I love being able to open any size jar so easily! In fact the main reason I bought it a couple months ago was that I love the organic mango slices I buy in a 3 lb. 12 oz. (60-ounce) jar with a four inch lid which is so difficult for me to open with our old opener. My husband installed it on the underside of a cabinet with just the supplied adhesive sticker and it was strong enough on its own without even needing to use the screws that came with it.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara KTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Not for the handicapped!
customer_reviews.text: I dislike that it only has teeth on one side because it doesn’t have as good a grip. Also it said it was great for those with hand and/or wrist problems. I have a broken left wrist that’s healing and a sprained right wrist. So much pressure on the jar is needed that it’s impossible to open.
customer_reviews.author: Donna Beth

customer_reviews.title: This product is handy to use and works great.
customer_reviews.text: I really like this product and have given away 7 or 8 of them to friends and family. It easily attaches to the bottom of a kitchen cabinet and is practically invisible any you always know where it is. To use just slide any size lid into the v shaped teeth and twist the container. You have much greater leverage so the lid comes off easily. After 10 years of using this I have not found anything that opens with a twist that it couldn't handle easily. The teeth can leave two rough spots on the lid if it is hard to open.
customer_reviews.author: Wizard on holiday

customer_reviews.title: Just like grandma used to have
customer_reviews.text: My grandma had one of these for as long as I can remember. Maybe not the same brand, but the exact same style. When I came across a review on YT comparing jar openers this was the highest rated. I remember it being really easy for my grandmother to use, so I bought one for the house me and my girlfriend are renting. It's just as awesome as I remember. I used the sticky pad that came with it to fasten it underneath my cabinet and it hasn't budged!
customer_reviews.author: Darren M.

customer_reviews.title: works on almost all jars
customer_reviews.text: We have a drawer full of jar openers that my wife didn't like or could not use. This opener stays in the same place (no looking through the drawer), and so far has opened every jar or bottle she has used it for. I don't trust adhesive pads for long term, so I put it up with screws (it has the mounting holes). Our cabinets have recessed bottoms so I had to add a small block of wood to flush mount the opener.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A must-have for carpal-tunnel or arthritis in hands!!!!
customer_reviews.text: This thing has been a life saver!!! With carpal-tunnel and arthritis, I had got to where opening anything was nearly impossible. And I live alone, so I don't have anyone to go whining to when I needed something opened. I would either work on it until I got it opened (and was in a lot of pain) or gave up on whatever it was I was opening. But with this, I can open ANYTHING!!! Great product!! Thanks!!
customer_reviews.author: Crystal A.

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: As I have gotten older it has become harder and harder to get the lids off of jars. My old techniques of running the jar under hot water and banging it on the counter were losing their effectiveness because of the arthritis in hands. This little gadget just works great. I do grasp the jar with both hands but the lid comes right off.
customer_reviews.author: tygereye50

customer_reviews.title: Damages the jars
customer_reviews.text: It's dangerous and damages the lids with big metal teeth. I was planning on using this for drinks and jars that were hard to open, but it destroyed them.
customer_reviews.author: Val S.

customer_reviews.title: Best Christmas gift from son.
customer_reviews.text: My son gave me an EZ Off Jar Opener 3 years ago for Christmas. It still works perfectly, and I love it as my grip strength is poor and one twist and the lid unscrews. I would suggest that you not mount the opener far back under your cabinet so you don't have to reach far back under the cabinet to unscrew the lid. The wide end needs to face out with the narrow V part at the back for ease.
customer_reviews.author: Chase Womble

customer_reviews.title: Welcome to the year 2020.
customer_reviews.text: It’s not often that I actually write a review on Amazon. I give a product some stars and move on. It was extremely easy to install this product and works perfect. I chose it over all of the other jar opener options out there for two reasons: 1. Really good reviews on Amazon. 2. It took up no space in a kitchen drawer or cabinet. I love this product so much, I’ll be purchasing a few more for my friends and family.
customer_reviews.author: R. Jones

customer_reviews.title: Most Effective Opener
customer_reviews.text: I tried several jar openers and found this one to be the best for really hard to open jars. What seems to make it better than most is that you can grip the jars with both hands and do not have to try to hold item with one of your hands. I quickly install mine on the bottom of a cabinet in my garage and have used it frequently since then. Pros - relatively inexpensive, easy to install and works well on most jars. Cons - have to raise the jar up higher than a counter unit and does need to be mounted somewhere
customer_reviews.author: David G

customer_reviews.title: easily opens any jar
customer_reviews.text: We installed this when I had a broken wrist and I could open anything with one hand. But after being all healed, it's still the best jar opener and wonderful for someone with arthritis. I've tried the hand-held rubber tong type and rubber gripper circles. They are ok for someone strong, but with arthritis or one hand, the cabinet-mount EZ Off opener is simply the best. Opens everything from a juice or soda bottle to a wide pickle jar. The teeth do grip a bit, so don't force it too tightly on metal lids.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: My wife can open any jar sold in a grocery store with this opener!
customer_reviews.text: Opens every jar with a lid presented to it! It is a great tool to have in the kitchen under a cabinet for both women and men. We have owned this opener for years and have purchase almost ten of them and have given them to every family member and several as gifts to friends. They all love this opener. It has never failed to open a jar and it is easy to use and accommodates large lids on those commercial jars of pickle relish and the like. Great buy for the price, easy to affix to the under side of a kitchen or storage cabinet and give them as a gift. Your friends and family will say, thanks!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great product/purchase!
customer_reviews.text: I love this jar opener! I have arthritis, so it's difficult to open jars and screw off lid drinks. You just slide the jar/bottle into the teeth and turn. It's so simple and quick to undo lids. It's not automatic like I thought it would be for some reason, but I actually prefer it this way so that there aren't any cords in sight. We installed ours underneath our overhead cabinets & it's so slim, it's not visible when just looking at the cabinets. We've had ours about a week or two now, and I am so happy with it. Affordable, convenient, and effortless!
customer_reviews.author: AinsleyB

customer_reviews.title: The best thing to help open impossible jars!
customer_reviews.text: This is going to be a game changer. Especially with my Rheumatoid Arthritis— I’m looking forward to how simple the hardest jar ever way to open. See photo. For context, it was sealed shut so hard — where I went to close the cap as tight as I could for context and there is that much gap that was held tight before opening. Took me a second to opening it with this product. (it was sitting in my fridge because I gave up on it). I havent installed it yet, but will!
customer_reviews.author: Jenny D

customer_reviews.title: Works as intended.
customer_reviews.text: Seems to work well. A few times my wife has had to go to neighbor's houses to get lids off. Not anymore! Only thing I didn't realize is how sharp the teeth on it are. They are razor sharp! We mounted this in our garage as we are afraid our climbing toddler could climb up on the kitchen counter and be seriously injured by the teeth on this thing.
customer_reviews.author: Sherri

customer_reviews.title: Why didn’t I buy this a long time ago?
customer_reviews.text: Installed this in about five minutes. Followed the tip in other reviews of putting the small end of the V towards the front of the cupboard. This works like a dream. Installation was super simple. Used the adhesive first and then was a simple process of putting screws in. Didn’t even need to drill. Why didn’t I buy this years ago? Definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Mysteri

customer_reviews.title: Works well, screws are too long.
customer_reviews.text: You'll probably need to search thru your junk box or make a trip to the hardware - the provided screws were too long, and would have come thru the bottom shelf of my cabinets. Find the right screws, and mount it so the narrow part of the opening faces you (away from the wall). It's easier to pull a jar towards you while turning, than to try to push and turn.
customer_reviews.author: Irv Mullins

customer_reviews.title: An Arthritic Lifesaver!!
customer_reviews.text: I am so pleasantly surprised with this product! I have arthritis and no power when it comes to even opening anything - even a water bottle! I’m always asking my grandsons, daughter, husband to open bottles and jars for me (very inconvenient when no one else is home!) The teeth are very sharp so be careful when handling it. (Like a saw not like a knife). My husband installed it on the underside of a pantry shelf at a convenient height for me. Any size jar fits into the “V” and you simply twist once and the jar opens! Voilà! C’est magnifique!
customer_reviews.author: Margo T.

customer_reviews.title: I can open cans now!
customer_reviews.text: Wow, if only I found this earlier. This is a wonderful device for opening any size bottle from water bottles to spaghetti jars. It was easy to install and extremely easy to use. As I've grown older and have used my hands for my day job as a free lance court reporter to doing hand-intensive art work, my hands are pretty susceptible to tendonitis, et cetera. But with this thing, wow, I don't have to ask anybody to open a darn thing. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: Izzie

customer_reviews.title: "Best present ever"
customer_reviews.text: My 92 year-old mother said this jar opener may be the "best present ever." The strength has gone out of her hands, but this gizmo more than makes up for it. I installed it under one of her kitchen cabinets and she uses it to open all kinds of jars and bottles--and LOVES it. If that isn't a good enough recommendation for you, I don't know what would be!
customer_reviews.author: Jack Zavada

customer_reviews.title: Missing screws but works well when installed
customer_reviews.text: This opener has sharp metal teeth that work well to grip the lids of jars when trying to open them. It seems to work well for my mom (who I bought and installed it for) who has arthritic hands and difficulty applying pressure with her thumbs. The product box said it includes screws for installation but no screws were included. I happened to have some screws in my house to use, but other customers may be inconvenienced by missing this component of the product especially if they happen to be elderly with limited ability to assess and acquire screws of proper length/pitch.
customer_reviews.author: Justin Stuart

customer_reviews.title: Everyone needs one of these!
customer_reviews.text: This is the best jar opener I have ever found. And very reasonably prices. It will open jars or bottles of any size from large pickle jars to bottles of water. Installed under a cabinet it takes no space and you always know where it is! No rustling through drawers to find it. I have bought several for family and friends. Great gift “gadget basket” for for new home owners or anyone who has difficulty opening jars.
customer_reviews.author: DF

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME
customer_reviews.text: I have 1 that I use I got this for my Mom who is 66 years old. She has arthritis bad in her hands and I think this will help her a lot. I love it. I also have arthritis in my hands. This is a must for older people in my opinion. I GIVE it the best product ever for people that has no grip in their hands and with people with Arthritis in their hands
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Hatcher

customer_reviews.title: Just buy it !
customer_reviews.text: You will wonder why you waited so long. Bought a spare incase house burns down ! Its that good ! Install it at front of under-cabinet with “arrow” facing toward you. This is backward of the instructions, but works WAY BETTER. If you decide not to purchase this, then good. It will be more for the rest of us that are (in the know).
customer_reviews.author: phils

customer_reviews.title: Excellent!
customer_reviews.text: I have very arthritic hands, and opening jars is sometimes impossible...BUT, not anymore! I installed this in less than 5 minutes with my cordless drill. The adhesive backing made it easy to decide exactly where I wanted it, and then to mark where I needed the screws. I’ve opened several hard-to-open jars easily. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Annie

customer_reviews.title: Great and functional for disabled mother!!!
customer_reviews.text: High quality and inexpensive product. This was the one gift my mother wanted for Christmas. Just like the one I remember her using in kitchen when I was a kid. She was born with 1 arm, so items like this really help her to get things done without feeling like she has to rely on others. Great gift especially for disabled, elderly, or anyone with arthritis etc!
customer_reviews.author: Bethany L

customer_reviews.title: Works extremely well, but does damage lids (sharp "grips" ...
customer_reviews.text: Works extremely well, but does damage lids (sharp "grips" leave scratches and gouges in the metal). It works well on disposable bottles, but I cringe any time I use it on a stainless steel or reusable jar. If I could find something else that worked without damaging the lids, I would use it. For now, this will have to do.
customer_reviews.author: josie m.

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install and working great so far
customer_reviews.text: This arrived promptly and was easy to install. It does what it says by allowing you to open the lids on tough jars easily. Why strain trying to open a jar when this can do it much easier and safely. The jar is level when using the opener so you don't have to worry about anything spilling or leaking once the lid to the jar twists and opens. In the past I've tried to open jars by turning them sideways to get a better grip and sometimes when they all of a sudden open part of the contents has leaked out (such as juice from a jar of pickles). This can prevent those messes. I recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Lonestarcraig

customer_reviews.title: Great Product, Easy Install
customer_reviews.text: This is an EXCELLENT product for hard / tough to open jars, bottles of any size. When I installed I placed the ezoff with the point of the V facing me and the opening of the V away. I have found this to be much easier for opening things and you can utilize two hands this way. It comes down to preference which way you want to install. So simple and easy to use for people of all ages and strengths. The only complaint I have is the included hardware screws could be longer. It would ensure that the ezoff is very secure. If you have longer screws, I recommend you utilize those.
customer_reviews.author: Romey Rome

customer_reviews.title: Never worry about opening a jar/bottle again!
customer_reviews.text: Brilliant product. Really works with one hand. I bought it because I was having hand surgery and thought this would help (and my hands were already a little weak before the surgery). Absolutely worked. Good for arthritis or hand weakness. Easy install. Need a small drill for the 3 screws. Took under 5 minutes. It's hidden under your cabinet so you can't see it from inside your kitchen or workspace.
customer_reviews.author: Diane Mann

customer_reviews.title: I'd be lost without this
customer_reviews.text: I have used these for years and can open any jar even with my old arthritic hands. I can't imagine that the adhesive would be enough for this though, you will need to screw it onto your cupboard bottom. The wood on my cupboard is so thin that the screws stick through a tiny bit but not enough to cause problems for me.
customer_reviews.author: Vickie S. Chapman

customer_reviews.title: This is a very handy bottle and jar opener
customer_reviews.text: I'm getting older and am not as strong as I used to be. My usual jar openers required one hand for the bottle, and the other to twist the lid. I installed the EZ off Jar Opener on the bottom of an a upper cabinet. That allows me to hold the glass jars using BOTH hands on the jar, and it's easy to twist the lid off.
customer_reviews.author: Jo in Maine

customer_reviews.title: Love this ! Makes life a little easier every day !
customer_reviews.text: I love this so much, I bought 2 more for my sisters. We are all over 60, but I wish I had one since 40 years ago, it's that great. No more banging jars on the floor, or looking for pliers to get a bottle open I had to install a piece of wood under my upper cabinet to attach it properly, but other than that the install was easy. Highly recommend this product to everyone !
customer_reviews.author: Happy Camper22

customer_reviews.title: Works for me
customer_reviews.text: Works great for me but my mom still has issues with it. She still does not have the strength to use it. You have to keep it very firmly against the teeth or it will slip and scar up the lid. I have opened bottles that I could not by hand. I really wanted it for my mom but will have to look elsewhere for her needs.
customer_reviews.author: Enrique

customer_reviews.title: Great product.  You don't have to mount it to a cupboard for it to work.
customer_reviews.text: I have used this on small jars, large jars, the big top to my espresso machine that sometimes vacuum seals itself closed and even my husband can't get the top off! I didn't mount it to the cupboard, I keep it in a drawer. You just put it on top of your jar and turn, then you can put it away. Or take it out to the garage to open other containers, etc. I've had other jar openers that worked like pliers, gave them all to Good Will! This one does everything.
customer_reviews.author: M. Nichols

customer_reviews.title: I just love my opener use it all the time and no one knows it is even there
customer_reviews.text: This was easy to install I did it myself. I use this gadget all the time I think every house needs one of these. My mom is 85 and has had such a hard time with bottles and jars for quite some time so I got her one also now she does not call as often to help her open simple items she does herself. Great gift also.
customer_reviews.author: C. Ortega

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product
customer_reviews.text: I rarely write reviews but this deserves one, it’s a life changer! No more waiting for help to open a jar again. Works perfectly. My husband had it installed in minutes under the lip of the cupboard. Totally hidden from view. It works on all sizes we’ve tried so far, from small plastic caps to large aluminum caps. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Bo

customer_reviews.title: Out of sight~~used daily!
customer_reviews.text: The adhesive on the top of this was great for adhering it under top cabinet. The screws went in easily and it works like a charm. Just had Shoder replacement and need wrist surgery, so no strength to open jars. Can slide a jar into teeth and turn it with left hand. Even a very tight lid comes off easily.
customer_reviews.author: Susan Peck Knueven

customer_reviews.title: Not working for Kerrs jars
customer_reviews.text: This opener will open almost each jar but Kerrs ones with metal lid. I am pickling every year and it was the whole point that I bought this opener. So disappointed that it is not working for Kerrs jars.
customer_reviews.author: Tati

customer_reviews.title: This is great
customer_reviews.text: We both have carpel tunnel syndrome and have lost some grip strength. I had previously purchased another jar opener that didn't work. I remembered that my mother-in-law had one of these. It was easy to install under a cabinet. It is so easy to use, and it works like a charm. It will open all sizes of jars.
customer_reviews.author: Joyful Nana

customer_reviews.title: Great for arthritic hands
customer_reviews.text: I have developed arthritis in my fingers and was having a lot of difficulty opening jars and bottles. This product is wonderful. It has an adhesive pad, but also comes with screws for attaching. I used both, to keep it in place while the screws were used. Works on the tiniest bottle top up to a 4 inch or so lid.
customer_reviews.author: Bothump

customer_reviews.title: Such a lifesaver!
customer_reviews.text: I originally bought this for my mom because of her arthritic hands & also because she's not always strong enough to open jars/bottles. Well, this thing save me after having hand surgery. You can open jars, bottles, nail polish bottles, etc. It doesn't matter if it is big or small. This is a must have for any home with kids, people with hand injuries, weak hands or hand issues
customer_reviews.author: bdx

customer_reviews.title: opens any jar
customer_reviews.text: OK, really didn't want another appliance cluttering up my kitchen. This mounts under the cupboard I forget it's there! This guy is a power horse..it was a gift and it works well! My 85 yr old mother in law can use it with ease. From Boost plastic bottles to huge pickle jars...this opens all!
customer_reviews.author: Michelle M.

customer_reviews.title: Great tool for elderly
customer_reviews.text: A friend gave us one. We constantly use it. Vacuum-sealed food containers are especially difficult to open. Sent one of these to my 84 year old parents. They really appreciate how much less strength is needed, simplicity,and greatly reduced frustration. Works great with any size rotating lid, top, or cap.
customer_reviews.author: S. Jensen

customer_reviews.title: Excellent solution to perpetual problem
customer_reviews.text: So many jars are mechanically tightened nowadays that I frequently fear I’ll have to break the jar to open the product. I haven’t yet had to, but one time I did take a jar back to the grocery store. No one there could open it either, and its replacement wasn’t a whole lot easier. Hence the EZ Off. It works beautifully! I installed it with the point of the “v” pointed toward me as recommended by another Amazon reviewer, but the manufacturer plainly suggests the opposite. Not to worry. The EZ Off will open jars efficiently whatever direction you choose.
customer_reviews.author: MamaJohn

customer_reviews.title: Works extremely well! Get one, seniors!
customer_reviews.text: One of the best gadgets ever! I use it ALL the time. It opens bottles, jars, anything with a screw type lid...metal and plastic. From large size mayonnaise jars to smaller bottles like water or ketchup. I am so glad I bought this! Hubby installed it under counter by sink quite easily (he's not typically a 'handy' man!). I really, really, REALLY recommend this, especially for senior citizens!
customer_reviews.author: MsReb

customer_reviews.title: wrists are painful, opening jars used to hurt
customer_reviews.text: Getting older, wrists are painful, opening jars used to hurt, this solved the challenges my wife and I were having. She recently had shoulder surgery and needed a container opening aid, I bought this because it has metal teeth instead of plastic, good choice it turns out. This item is a must-have from now on, I have recommended it to many friends and will continue to do so. Mounting was easy with the supplied tape as it helming the opener in place while I set the attachment screws.
customer_reviews.author: Steve O

customer_reviews.title: Great and thoughtful gift!
customer_reviews.text: This is one of the most useful things you can buy! This works on any size jar with little effort and is easy to install. This is a must-have for single people who don't have anyone else to ”try and open this”. No more aggravating slams against the counter or hitting the jars on your counters! Well worth the price and we'll made.
customer_reviews.author: REPA

customer_reviews.title: Very effective but dings the jar lids
customer_reviews.text: Easy installation. Works well. Still working on finding the least pressure possible as the teeth are so sharp they can really rip up lids and especially with plastic it leaves sharp edges. I like that it's out of sight out of mind and doesn't take up drawer space. Update: 12/18 As other users commented, the screws are indeed too short. They started to come out. I replaced the them with longer screws.
customer_reviews.author: Sandal

customer_reviews.title: Excellent opener!
customer_reviews.text: I can only describe this jar opener as a wonderful kitchen tool. So far I've used it to open small pimento jars to large mayo jars, and all sizes in between. I even opened a reluctant screw top on a half-gallon of milk. No more wrestling and straining to break the seal on anything. This is also a great bargain for such an effective tool. My only regret is that I didn't find this EZ off jar opener years ago.
customer_reviews.author: Agnes Ten

customer_reviews.title: just doesn't work
customer_reviews.text: I've tried it on several jars and can't get it to work. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: MaryAnn

customer_reviews.title: Can be helpful
customer_reviews.text: I had some initial trouble with this jar opener, but it seems to work as intended. It is a little difficult to hold the jar up under the cabinet and exert enough pressure to break the seal on the lid, but this is due to my physical limitations and no reflection on the device itself. It was easy to mount under the upper cabinet, and so it remains handy and doesn't add another gadget to my overcrowded kitchen drawers.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Followed the advice of other posters and attached the opener with the point of the V facing towards me. It's such a breeze to open jars now. The only issue to be aware of is that it does scrape the metal lids. The sharp metal teeth on the opener dig into the lids, so if you're planning on saving the jars with the lids, just be aware of this.
customer_reviews.author: Goose

customer_reviews.title: Why wait- order it already!
customer_reviews.text: Wish I would have gotten this sooner. Bought huge jar of honey lemon ginger mix. Neither my husband or I could remove the jar lid. Ironically same jar someone else posted in here having trouble with lid. Like magic, it came right off with this gadget. Easy to install under cabinet. No need for the screws- sticky adhesive tape holds it up with no problem.
customer_reviews.author: just

product_meta.title: EZ Off Jar Opener - Under Cabinet Jar Lid & Bottle Opener - Great for Seniors & Weak or Arthritic Hands
feature_bullets: THE EZ OFF JAR OPENER WILL OPEN TOUGH LIDS EFFORTLESSLY - EZ Off will grab hold of any lid whether it's factory sealed, child proof, tamper proof or just stuck from what's inside the jar. A simple twist and The EZ Off Jar Opener will deliver
OPENS ALL JAR LID SIZES -- Try anything small like a bottle of water, nail polish or a wide container of pickles, peanuts, canned fruits, jams, molasses, marshmallow creme or maraschino cherries

INSTALLATION AND OPERATION ARE EASY -- It's easy to install the EZ Off with the pre-attached, peel-and-stick adhesive and the 3 included screws. It's ideal for children, the elderly, those with arthritis, carpal tunnel, those working in kitchens and those with limited use of hands or amputees
YOU'LL NEVER KNOW IT'S THERE -- This jar opener hides neatly out of sight under a cabinet, cupboard, counter, or shelf, taking no valuable storage space
THE EZ OFF JAR OPENER IS MADE IN THE USA -- The EZ Off is made with premium materials by American workers here in the USA.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.7 out of 5 stars5,195 ratings4.7 out of 5 stars
